div.div: A single gunshot was heard as authorities moved into the cabin where Christopher Dorner was believed to be holed up.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12KdyTd&via=Digg&text=The Final Shot?

div.a: Obama’s 2013 State Of The Union Address

div.div: The following is the text as prepared for delivery of President Obama’s State of the Union Address, as provided by the White House.

div.a: Surprise, Iran Photoshopped Their Fake Super-Stealth Jet Onto Desktop Wallpaper

div.div: Iran's homegrown, radar-evading stealth fighter jet is flying the very cinematic skies, according to state news agency/Iranian propaganda machine Khouz News.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yanuj1&via=Digg&text=Surprise, Iran Photoshopped Their Fake Super-Stealth Jet Onto Desktop Wallpaper

div.div: Here are the 54 foreign governments involved in the CIA's secret detention and extraordinary rendition operations according to their culpability.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WZ48Oy&via=Digg&text=The CIA's Torture Network

div.div: WENT BACK IN TIME AND SHOT FIRST

div.a: How The Star Wars Kessel Run Turns Han Solo Into A Time-Traveler

div.div: You’ll hear any reputable Star Wars fan point it out eventually: Han Solo’s famous boast that the Millennium Falcon “made the Kessel Run in less than 12 parsecs” may have sounded impressive, but from an astronomical perspective, it made no sense.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z7m3GY&via=Digg&text=How The Star Wars Kessel Run Turns Han Solo Into A Time-Traveler

div.div: Shatner did not mince words in an interview when it comes to his opinion on the news J.J. Abrams is to direct "Star Wars Episode VII."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vblmc4&via=Digg&text=Shatner: J.J. Abrams Is A 'Pig'

div.a: A Brief Timeline Of North Korea Doing Insane And Terrifying Things

div.div: Last night, North Korea unexpectedly decided to test a nuclear bomb without the common courtesy of telling anybody first. But it's just the latest in a long line of terrifying and crazy things that the country gets up to.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YU7ym9&via=Digg&text=A Brief Timeline Of North Korea Doing Insane And Terrifying Things

div.div: PEOPLE YOU WILL BE JEALOUS OF

div.a: This Girl Has A Higher IQ Than Einstein

div.div: Lauren Marbe, 16, shocked teachers by scoring 161 on the Mensa brain test after she was entered with other pupils from her school for fun.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ya02m6&via=Digg&text=This Girl Has A Higher IQ Than Einstein

div.a: Is There Such A Thing As An 'Oscar Curse'?

div.div: Actresses' careers languish after Oscar shows up. Is it just coincidence -- or proof Hollywood's tough on women?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U9Mnxr&via=Digg&text=Is There Such A Thing As An 'Oscar Curse'?

div.div: JORDY WILL NEVER NEED A VISOR

div.a: First Bionic Eye Coming To The U.S. Market

div.div: After many years of research, the FDA is about to approve the first bionic eye ever for sale in the US.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14PP2hT&via=Digg&text=First Bionic Eye Coming To The U.S. Market

div.div: There's a quiet change happening, one you won't likely hear much about in tonight's address. Slowly, with very few observers noting it, Obama has become our first cyber-war president.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VT18kF&via=Digg&text=The First Cyber War President

div.a: Physicists Discover What A Multiverse Might Really Be Like

div.div: It's likely that you've seen video of ferrofluids doing things like growing spines when exposed to magnets, or being built up into sculptures by artists using magnetic fields. But what if they're not just artistic triumphs? What if ferrofluids can act as models and let scientists learn about the multiverse?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XwaEO4&via=Digg&text=Physicists Discover What A Multiverse Might Really Be Like

div.a: 'DuckTales' Invented A New Animated Wonderland—That Quickly Disappeared

div.div: DuckTales, the most successful show of Disney’s short-lived television-animation renaissance—and a show that kicked off a brief interest in syndicated afternoon animation from a host of media companies—has mostly disappeared from the limelight.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14O2eE5&via=Digg&text='DuckTales' Invented A New Animated Wonderland—That Quickly Disappeared

div.a: The Future Of The Republican Party Is By The Pool At The Biltmore

div.div: The talk at the Miami hotel where Jeb Bush works, and Marco Rubio works out, is of the next president. But can the young senator get out from under Jeb’s shadow?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y8vPUA&via=Digg&text=The Future Of The Republican Party Is By The Pool At The Biltmore

div.div: There’s a growing set of the super-rich who are pushing the boundaries of luxury to its limits.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/159bvYq&via=Digg&text=How Billionaires Travel

div.a: Audio Of Gun Battle With Alleged L.A. Cop Killer Dorner Is Terrifying

div.div: Police reportedly have ex-cop and wanted spree killer Chris Dorner cornered in Big Bear area, a reporter on the scene captures the sound of repeated gunfire exchanges.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12JNaZE&via=Digg&text=Audio Of Gun Battle With Alleged L.A. Cop Killer Dorner Is Terrifying

div.a: MIT Learns That Robots Work Better When You Treat Them Like Humans

div.div: MIT researchers discovered that cross-training, a technique used to improve human teams, can also foster better collaboration between humans and robots.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VdBaex&via=Digg&text=MIT Learns That Robots Work Better When You Treat Them Like Humans

div.a: What Does Horse Meat Taste Like?

div.div: People throughout Ireland and the U.K. have been scandalized by revelations that some of their beef products (such as frozen beef lasagna) have actually been made with horse meat instead of beef. So what does it taste like?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WYUbkb&via=Digg&text=What Does Horse Meat Taste Like?

div.div: The war machine built by Emperor Palpatine and run by Darth Vader is a spectacularly bad fighting force, as evidenced by all of the pieces of Death Star littering space. But of all the Empire’s failures, none is a more spectacular military fiasco than the Battle of Hoth at the beginning of "The Empire Strikes Back."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z7m6Td&via=Digg&text=Inside The Battle Of Hoth

div.a: DC Under Fire For Hiring Anti-Gay Superman Writer

div.div: Ender's Game author Orson Scott Card has called gay marriage 'the end of democracy' – and some comics fans want him fired.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14OttOL&via=Digg&text=DC Under Fire For Hiring Anti-Gay Superman Writer

div.a: Does Anybody Really Want An iWatch?

div.div: Many people think an Apple watch is a brilliant idea, since the Kickstarter-based Pebble watch got millions of dollars in funding, and since smart watches were all the rage at this year's CES. But before you throw out your Timex in anticipation, let's take a trip down memory lane and remember the smartwatch's rocky history.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V4eWhD&via=Digg&text=Does Anybody Really Want An iWatch?

div.div: The richest Americans probably live right where you think they do.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WGMWPA&via=Digg&text=Where The Rich Live

div.a: Everything You Need To Know About North Korea's Nuclear Test In One Graphic

div.div: North Korea has successfully tested a nuclear device with an estimated yield of seven kilotons, just under half the power of the bomb dropped on Hiroshima in the Second World War.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12bmX6d&via=Digg&text=Everything You Need To Know About North Korea's Nuclear Test In One Graphic

div.div: PRETEND YOU KNOW WHAT THIS IS

div.a: How 'Bullet Time' Will Revolutionize Exascale Computing

div.div: The famous Hollywood filming technique will change the way we access the huge computer simulations of the future, say computer scientists.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VRm77t&via=Digg&text=How 'Bullet Time' Will Revolutionize Exascale Computing

div.div: You’ve heard it before, and no doubt you’ll hear it again: The Cosby sweater is back with a vengeance.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WiGGfk&via=Digg&text=The Cosby Chic Comeback

div.div: FTC call for robocall-killing systems attracts Pi-wielding inventor.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VdnnEP&via=Digg&text=How One Man Is Killing Robocalls Using Rasberry Pi

div.a: A Map Of Dirty Place Names

div.div: For those of you looking to imitate the famous Jackass skit that took place in Mianus, Connecticut, geographer Gary Gale has prepared some excellent source material.

div.a: The Goofy, Anti-Nazi Parody Video That Enraged Goebbels

div.div: Here's a video of the British trolling the Nazis hard.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ya3gGm&via=Digg&text=The Goofy, Anti-Nazi Parody Video That Enraged Goebbels

div.a: How A PS3 Game Launched Japan's Newest Sex Symbol

div.div: These days, it seems like you cannot turn on the TV in Japan without seeing her. Her name is Mitsu Dan.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V2GJ1S&via=Digg&text=How A PS3 Game Launched Japan's Newest Sex Symbol

div.a: The Tesla Model S Is The World's Most Expensive Beta Test

div.div: Tesla Motors' website promises that the new Model S sedan is a car "so advanced it sets the new standard for premium performance" while delivering "unprecedented range and a thrilling drive experience." But customers resemble beta testers more than anything else.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14Q6N0J&via=Digg&text=The Tesla Model S Is The World's Most Expensive Beta Test

div.a: When Does Facebook Take Rape Threats Seriously?

div.div: This winter, a 21-year-old named Julia decided to visit the Swedish Facebook page for international clothing company HM. Little did she know she was about to enrage thousands and eventually end up in the center of a national debate about the treatment of women online.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VPCerA&via=Digg&text=When Does Facebook Take Rape Threats Seriously?

div.a: Woman Drank Herself To Death With Coca-Cola

div.div: A New Zealand woman's 2.2 gallon a day Coca-Cola habit was a major factor in her death, a coroner found Tuesday, urging the soft drink giant to put health warnings on its caffeinated products.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12r6sOO&via=Digg&text=Woman Drank Herself To Death With Coca-Cola

div.a: TV Hackers Announce Dead Are Rising

div.div: The emergency broadcast system of a television station in Montana is hacked to broadcast the announcement that the undead are coming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12oQHI9&via=Digg&text=TV Hackers Announce Dead Are Rising
